title: Lost Research Station Adventure #35
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Entrance Airlock
rooms.description: A cold metal airlock chamber covered in frost. Emergency lights cast a red glow over scattered equipment and frozen condensation on the walls. Through the inner window, you can see the darkened corridors of the research station. The air is thin and stale.

items.name: emergency equipment locker
items.description: A tall metal locker with two compartments, partially frozen shut

items.name: research station log
items.description: A digital tablet with the last entries from the station crew
items.text: Final Log Entry - Dr. Sarah Chen, Lead Researcher: The experiment has gone critical. We're evacuating to the escape pods. Station established 2047. If anyone finds this, the main lab is sealed. Only Dr. Marcus Webb has override access. The specimen is contained in Sector 7.

items.name: supply crate
items.description: A sealed crate with emergency supplies

items.name: powerful flashlight
items.description: A high intensity flashlight for dark corridors

items.name: security access keycard
items.description: A keycard labeled 'Security Level 2 Access'

items.name: inner airlock door
items.description: A heavy door leading into the main station corridor. The security panel blinks red.

rooms.name: Main Research Corridor
rooms.description: A long corridor with flickering fluorescent lights. The walls are lined with photographs of the research team and informational posters about the station's work. Doors lead to various labs and offices. A large security door blocks access to the main laboratory at the far end.

items.name: photograph of Dr Chen
items.description: A framed photo of the lead researcher
items.text: Dr. Sarah Chen - Lead Researcher. Specializes in xenobiology and containment protocols.

items.name: photograph of Dr Webb
items.description: A framed photo of the station director
items.text: Dr. Marcus Webb - Station Director. Responsible for all security protocols and emergency procedures.

items.name: photograph of Dr Torres
items.description: A framed photo of a young scientist
items.text: Dr. Elena Torres - Junior Researcher. Her family lives in the Arctic Research Base. Studies specimen behavior in Sector 7.

items.name: station information board
items.description: A bulletin board with various notices and memos
items.text: NOTICE: All personnel must memorize emergency protocols. Specimen containment is in Sector 7. In case of breach, evacuate immediately to the Arctic Research Base.

items.name: corridor desk unit
items.description: A small desk with drawers built into the wall

items.name: maintenance memo
items.description: A note about station systems
items.text: MAINTENANCE LOG: Lab door override code is based on Director Webb's credentials. His employee ID is written under his desk nameplate in his office.

items.name: director office door
items.description: A door labeled 'Director Marcus Webb - Station Command'

items.name: reinforced lab door
items.description: A massive reinforced door with a biometric scanner and keypad. Three security questions are displayed on the screen.

password_questions.question: Enter Station Director name:
password_questions.hint: Check the photographs in the corridor

password_questions.question: Enter specimen containment sector:
password_questions.hint: Look at the station log and information board

password_questions.question: Enter evacuation destination:
password_questions.hint: The information board mentions where to evacuate

rooms.name: Director's Office
rooms.description: A small office with a desk covered in papers and research reports. A computer terminal sits dark and lifeless. Personal items and commendations line the shelves.

items.name: director desk
items.description: A cluttered desk with various documents and a nameplate

items.name: hidden note under nameplate
items.description: A small note taped under the desk nameplate
items.text: Employee ID: MW-7734. This code can override the lab door in emergencies.

items.name: filing cabinet
items.description: A cabinet with research files and personnel records

items.name: classified research report
items.description: A confidential document about the station's work
items.text: PROJECT AURORA: Specimen exhibits unprecedented adaptive capabilities. Dr. Chen recommends extreme caution. Containment in Sector 7 holding at 99.7% integrity. Dr. Webb authorized for all override procedures.

rooms.name: Main Research Laboratory
rooms.description: You've reached the heart of the research station! A vast laboratory filled with sophisticated equipment and monitoring stations. In the center, a large containment chamber stands empty, its door hanging open. Beyond it, an emergency escape hatch glows with green light, showing the way to the evacuation pods.

items.name: empty containment chamber
items.description: A large reinforced chamber that once held the specimen. It's now empty.

items.name: monitoring station
items.description: A bank of screens showing various station systems
items.text: SYSTEM STATUS: Containment breach detected. Specimen location: Unknown. Evacuation pods: Active. All personnel evacuated successfully.

items.name: scattered research notes
items.description: Papers and tablets scattered across the workbenches

items.name: final message from Dr Chen
items.description: A handwritten note left behind
items.text: If you're reading this, you made it through. The specimen escaped but we contained it in the lower levels before evacuating. The station is safe now. Use the escape pods to get out. Good luck. - Dr. Sarah Chen

rooms.win_message: You've successfully navigated the abandoned research station and reached the main laboratory! The escape pod hatch opens before you, revealing a small spacecraft ready to take you to safety. As you climb aboard and initiate launch, you look back at the dark station one last time. Whatever happened here is over now, and you're going home. You win!
